trans-unit.source: Preparing Hard Drives for an Import Job
trans-unit.target: Preparing Hard Drives for an Import Job

trans-unit.source: To prepare one or more hard drives for an import job, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To prepare one or more hard drives for an import job, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Identify the data to import into the Blob service
trans-unit.target: Identify the data to import into the Blob service

trans-unit.source: Identify target virtual directories and blobs in the Blob service
trans-unit.target: Identify target virtual directories and blobs in the Blob service

trans-unit.source: Determine how many drives you'll need
trans-unit.target: Determine how many drives you'll need

trans-unit.source: Copy the data to each of your hard drives
trans-unit.target: Copy the data to each of your hard drives

trans-unit.source: For a sample workflow, see <link xlink:href="6eb1b1b7-c69f-4365-b5ef-3cd5e05eb72a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sample Workflow to Prepare Hard Drives for an Import Job</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a sample workflow, see <link xlink:href="6eb1b1b7-c69f-4365-b5ef-3cd5e05eb72a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sample Workflow to Prepare Hard Drives for an Import Job</link>.

trans-unit.source: Identify the Data to Be Imported
trans-unit.target: Identify the Data to Be Imported

trans-unit.source: The first step to creating an import job is to determine which directories and files you are going to import.
trans-unit.target: The first step to creating an import job is to determine which directories and files you are going to import.

trans-unit.source: This can be a list of directories, a list of unique files, or a combination of those two.
trans-unit.target: This can be a list of directories, a list of unique files, or a combination of those two.

trans-unit.source: When a directory is included, all files in the directory and its subdirectories will be part of the import job.
trans-unit.target: When a directory is included, all files in the directory and its subdirectories will be part of the import job.

trans-unit.source: Since subdirectories are included recursively when a parent directory is included, specify only the parent directory.
trans-unit.target: Since subdirectories are included recursively when a parent directory is included, specify only the parent directory.

trans-unit.source: Do not also specify any of its subdirectories.
trans-unit.target: Do not also specify any of its subdirectories.

trans-unit.source: Currently, the Microsoft Azure Import/Export tool has the following limitation: if a directory contains more data than a hard drive can contain, then the directory needs to be broken into smaller directories.
trans-unit.target: Currently, the Microsoft Azure Import/Export tool has the following limitation: if a directory contains more data than a hard drive can contain, then the directory needs to be broken into smaller directories.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a directory contains 2.5TB of data and the hard drive's capacity is only 2TB, then you need to break the 2.5TB directory into smaller directories.
trans-unit.target: For example, if a directory contains 2.5TB of data and the hard drive's capacity is only 2TB, then you need to break the 2.5TB directory into smaller directories.

trans-unit.source: This limitation will be addressed in a later version of the tool.
trans-unit.target: This limitation will be addressed in a later version of the tool.

trans-unit.source: Identify the Destination Locations in the Blob Service
trans-unit.target: Identify the Destination Locations in the Blob Service

trans-unit.source: For each directory or file that will be imported, you need to identify a destination virtual directory or blob in the Azure Blob service.
trans-unit.target: For each directory or file that will be imported, you need to identify a destination virtual directory or blob in the Azure Blob service.

trans-unit.source: You will use these targets as inputs to the Azure Import/Export tool.
trans-unit.target: You will use these targets as inputs to the Azure Import/Export tool.

trans-unit.source: Note that directories should be delimited with the forward slash character "/".
trans-unit.target: Note that directories should be delimited with the forward slash character "/".

trans-unit.source: The following table shows some examples of blob targets:
trans-unit.target: The following table shows some examples of blob targets:

trans-unit.source: Source file or directory
trans-unit.target: Source file or directory

trans-unit.source: Destination blob or virtual directory
trans-unit.target: Destination blob or virtual directory

trans-unit.source: H:\Video
trans-unit.target: H:\Video

trans-unit.source: https://mystorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net/video
trans-unit.target: https://mystorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net/video

trans-unit.source: H:\Photo
trans-unit.target: H:\Photo

trans-unit.source: https://mystorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net/photo
trans-unit.target: https://mystorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net/photo

trans-unit.source: K:\Temp\FavoriteVideo.ISO
trans-unit.target: K:\Temp\FavoriteVideo.ISO

trans-unit.source: https://mystorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net/favorite/FavoriteVideo.ISO
trans-unit.target: https://mystorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net/favorite/FavoriteVideo.ISO

trans-unit.source: \\myshare\john\music
trans-unit.target: \\myshare\john\music

trans-unit.source: https://mystorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net/music
trans-unit.target: https://mystorageaccount.blob.core.windows.net/music

trans-unit.source: Determine How Many Drives Are Needed
trans-unit.target: Determine How Many Drives Are Needed

trans-unit.source: Next, you need to determine:
trans-unit.target: Next, you need to determine:

trans-unit.source: The number of hard drives needed to store the data.
trans-unit.target: The number of hard drives needed to store the data.

trans-unit.source: The directories and/or standalone files that will be copied to each of your hard drive.
trans-unit.target: The directories and/or standalone files that will be copied to each of your hard drive.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you have the number of hard drives you will need to store the data you are transferring.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you have the number of hard drives you will need to store the data you are transferring.

trans-unit.source: Copy Data to Your Hard Drive
trans-unit.target: Copy Data to Your Hard Drive

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to call the Azure Import/Export tool to copy your data to one or more hard drives.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to call the Azure Import/Export tool to copy your data to one or more hard drives.

trans-unit.source: Each time you call the Azure Import/Export tool, you create a new <newTerm>copy session</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: Each time you call the Azure Import/Export tool, you create a new <newTerm>copy session</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: You create at least one copy session for each drive to which you copy data; in some cases, you may need more than one copy session to copy all of your data to single drive.
trans-unit.target: You create at least one copy session for each drive to which you copy data; in some cases, you may need more than one copy session to copy all of your data to single drive.

trans-unit.source: Here are some reasons that you may need multiple copy sessions:
trans-unit.target: Here are some reasons that you may need multiple copy sessions:

trans-unit.source: You must create a separate copy session for each drive that you copy to.
trans-unit.target: You must create a separate copy session for each drive that you copy to.

trans-unit.source: A copy session can copy either a single directory or a single blob to the drive.
trans-unit.target: A copy session can copy either a single directory or a single blob to the drive.

trans-unit.source: If you are copying multiple directories, multiple blobs, or a combination of both, you'll need to create multiple copy sessions.
trans-unit.target: If you are copying multiple directories, multiple blobs, or a combination of both, you'll need to create multiple copy sessions.

trans-unit.source: You can specify properties and metadata that will be set on the blobs imported as part of an import job.
trans-unit.target: You can specify properties and metadata that will be set on the blobs imported as part of an import job.

trans-unit.source: The properties or metadata that you specify for a copy session will apply to all blobs specified by that copy session.
trans-unit.target: The properties or metadata that you specify for a copy session will apply to all blobs specified by that copy session.

trans-unit.source: If you want to specify different properties or metadata for some blobs, you'll need to create a separate copy session.
trans-unit.target: If you want to specify different properties or metadata for some blobs, you'll need to create a separate copy session.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="e8541695-bcfb-4bf0-84d9-72c9de32a0a8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting Properties and Metadata During the Import Process</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="e8541695-bcfb-4bf0-84d9-72c9de32a0a8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting Properties and Metadata During the Import Process</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple machines that meet the requirements outlined in <link xlink:href="c312b1ab-5b9e-4d24-becd-790a88b3ba8d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting Up the WAImportExport Tool</link>, you can copy data to multiple hard drives in parallel by running an instance of this tool on each machine.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple machines that meet the requirements outlined in <link xlink:href="c312b1ab-5b9e-4d24-becd-790a88b3ba8d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting Up the WAImportExport Tool</link>, you can copy data to multiple hard drives in parallel by running an instance of this tool on each machine.

trans-unit.source: For each hard drive that you prepare with the Azure Import/Export tool, the tool will create a single journal file.
trans-unit.target: For each hard drive that you prepare with the Azure Import/Export tool, the tool will create a single journal file.

trans-unit.source: You will need the journal files from all of your drives to create the import job.
trans-unit.target: You will need the journal files from all of your drives to create the import job.

trans-unit.source: The journal file can also be used to resume drive preparation if the tool is interrupted.
trans-unit.target: The journal file can also be used to resume drive preparation if the tool is interrupted.

trans-unit.source: Azure Import/Export Tool Syntax for an Import Job
trans-unit.target: Azure Import/Export Tool Syntax for an Import Job

trans-unit.source: To prepare drives for an import job, call the Azure Import/Export tool with the <system>PrepImport</system> command.
trans-unit.target: To prepare drives for an import job, call the Azure Import/Export tool with the <system>PrepImport</system> command.

trans-unit.source: Which parameters you include depends on whether this is the first copy session, or a subsequent copy session.
trans-unit.target: Which parameters you include depends on whether this is the first copy session, or a subsequent copy session.

trans-unit.source: The first copy session for a drive requires some additional parameters to specify the storage account key; the target drive letter; whether the drive must be formatted; whether the drive must be encrypted and if so, the BitLocker key; and the log directory.
trans-unit.target: The first copy session for a drive requires some additional parameters to specify the storage account key; the target drive letter; whether the drive must be formatted; whether the drive must be encrypted and if so, the BitLocker key; and the log directory.

trans-unit.source: Here is the syntax for an initial copy session to copy a directory or a single file:
trans-unit.target: Here is the syntax for an initial copy session to copy a directory or a single file:

trans-unit.source: First Copy Session to Copy a Single Directory
trans-unit.target: First Copy Session to Copy a Single Directory

trans-unit.source: First Copy Session to Copy a Single File
trans-unit.target: First Copy Session to Copy a Single File

trans-unit.source: In subsequent copy sessions, you do not need to specify the initial parameters.
trans-unit.target: In subsequent copy sessions, you do not need to specify the initial parameters.

trans-unit.source: Here is the syntax for a subsequent copy session to copy a directory or a single file:
trans-unit.target: Here is the syntax for a subsequent copy session to copy a directory or a single file:

trans-unit.source: Subsequent Copy Sessions to Copy a Single Directory
trans-unit.target: Subsequent Copy Sessions to Copy a Single Directory

trans-unit.source: Subsequent Copy Sessions to Copy a Single File
trans-unit.target: Subsequent Copy Sessions to Copy a Single File

trans-unit.source: Parameters for the First Copy Session for a Hard Drive
trans-unit.target: Parameters for the First Copy Session for a Hard Drive

trans-unit.source: Each time you run the Azure Import/Export tool to copy files to the hard drive, the tool creates a copy session.
trans-unit.target: Each time you run the Azure Import/Export tool to copy files to the hard drive, the tool creates a copy session.

trans-unit.source: Each copy session copies a single directory or a single file to a hard drive.
trans-unit.target: Each copy session copies a single directory or a single file to a hard drive.

trans-unit.source: The state of the copy session is written to the journal file.
trans-unit.target: The state of the copy session is written to the journal file.

trans-unit.source: If a copy session is interrupted (for example, due to a system power loss), it can be resumed by running the tool again and specifying the journal file on the command line.
trans-unit.target: If a copy session is interrupted (for example, due to a system power loss), it can be resumed by running the tool again and specifying the journal file on the command line.

trans-unit.source: If you specify the <system>/format</system> parameter for the first copy session, the drive will be formatted and all data on the drive will be erased.
trans-unit.target: If you specify the <system>/format</system> parameter for the first copy session, the drive will be formatted and all data on the drive will be erased.

trans-unit.source: It's recommended that you use blank drives only for your copy session.
trans-unit.target: It's recommended that you use blank drives only for your copy session.

trans-unit.source: The command used for the first copy session for each drive requires different parameters than the commands for subsequent copy sessions.
trans-unit.target: The command used for the first copy session for each drive requires different parameters than the commands for subsequent copy sessions.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the additional parameters that are available for the first copy session:
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the additional parameters that are available for the first copy session:

trans-unit.source: Command-line parameter
trans-unit.target: Command-line parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: <system>/sk:</system><StorageAccountKey>
trans-unit.target: <system>/sk:</system><StorageAccountKey>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> The storage account key for the storage account to which the data will be imported.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> The storage account key for the storage account to which the data will be imported.

trans-unit.source: You must include either <system>/sk:</system><StorageAccountKey> or <system>/csas:</system><ContainerSas> in the command.
trans-unit.target: You must include either <system>/sk:</system><StorageAccountKey> or <system>/csas:</system><ContainerSas> in the command.

trans-unit.source: <system>/csas:</system><ContainerSas>
trans-unit.target: <system>/csas:</system><ContainerSas>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: The container SAS to use to import data to the storage account.
trans-unit.target: The container SAS to use to import data to the storage account.

trans-unit.source: You must include either <system>/sk:</system><StorageAccountKey> or <system>/csas:</system><ContainerSas> in the command.
trans-unit.target: You must include either <system>/sk:</system><StorageAccountKey> or <system>/csas:</system><ContainerSas> in the command.

trans-unit.source: The value for this parameter must begin with the container name, followed by a question mark (?) and the SAS token.
trans-unit.target: The value for this parameter must begin with the container name, followed by a question mark (?) and the SAS token.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: The permissions, whether specified on the URL or in a stored access policy, must include Read, Write, and Delete for import jobs, and Read, Write and List for export jobs.
trans-unit.target: The permissions, whether specified on the URL or in a stored access policy, must include Read, Write, and Delete for import jobs, and Read, Write and List for export jobs.

trans-unit.source: When this parameter is specified, all blobs to be imported or exported must be within the container specified in the shared access signature.
trans-unit.target: When this parameter is specified, all blobs to be imported or exported must be within the container specified in the shared access signature.

trans-unit.source: <system>/t:</system><TargetDriveLetter>
trans-unit.target: <system>/t:</system><TargetDriveLetter>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The drive letter of the target hard drive for the current copy session, without the trailing colon.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The drive letter of the target hard drive for the current copy session, without the trailing colon.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specify this parameter when the drive needs to be formatted; otherwise, omit it.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specify this parameter when the drive needs to be formatted; otherwise, omit it.

trans-unit.source: Before the tool formats the drive, it will prompt for a confirmation from console.
trans-unit.target: Before the tool formats the drive, it will prompt for a confirmation from console.

trans-unit.source: To suppress the confirmation, specify the /silentmode parameter.
trans-unit.target: To suppress the confirmation, specify the /silentmode parameter.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specify this parameter to suppress the confirmation for formatting the targert drive.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specify this parameter to suppress the confirmation for formatting the targert drive.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specified this parameter when the drive has not yet been encrypted with BitLocker and needs to be encrypted by the tool.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specified this parameter when the drive has not yet been encrypted with BitLocker and needs to be encrypted by the tool.

trans-unit.source: If the drive has already been encrypted with BitLocker, then omit this parameter and specify the <codeInline>/bk</codeInline> parameter, providing the existing BitLocker key.
trans-unit.target: If the drive has already been encrypted with BitLocker, then omit this parameter and specify the <codeInline>/bk</codeInline> parameter, providing the existing BitLocker key.

trans-unit.source: If you specify the <codeInline>/format</codeInline> parameter, then you must also specify the <codeInline>/encrypt</codeInline> parameter.
trans-unit.target: If you specify the <codeInline>/format</codeInline> parameter, then you must also specify the <codeInline>/encrypt</codeInline> parameter.

trans-unit.source: <system>/bk:</system><BitLockerKey>
trans-unit.target: <system>/bk:</system><BitLockerKey>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> If <codeInline>/encrypt</codeInline> is specified, omit this parameter.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> If <codeInline>/encrypt</codeInline> is specified, omit this parameter.

trans-unit.source: If <codeInline>/encrypt</codeInline> is omitted, you need to have already have encrypted the drive with BitLocker.
trans-unit.target: If <codeInline>/encrypt</codeInline> is omitted, you need to have already have encrypted the drive with BitLocker.

trans-unit.source: Use this parameter to specify the BitLocker key.
trans-unit.target: Use this parameter to specify the BitLocker key.

trans-unit.source: BitLocker encryption is required for all hard drives for import jobs.
trans-unit.target: BitLocker encryption is required for all hard drives for import jobs.

trans-unit.source: <system>/logdir:</system><LogDirectory>
trans-unit.target: <system>/logdir:</system><LogDirectory>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> The log directory specifies a directory to be used to store verbose logs as well as temporary manifest files.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> The log directory specifies a directory to be used to store verbose logs as well as temporary manifest files.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, the current directory will be used as the log directory.
trans-unit.target: If not specified, the current directory will be used as the log directory.

trans-unit.source: Parameters Required for All Copy Sessions
trans-unit.target: Parameters Required for All Copy Sessions

trans-unit.source: The journal file contains the status for all copy sessions for a hard drive.
trans-unit.target: The journal file contains the status for all copy sessions for a hard drive.

trans-unit.source: It also contains the information needed to create the import job.
trans-unit.target: It also contains the information needed to create the import job.

trans-unit.source: You must always specify a journal file when running the Azure Import/Export tool, as well as a copy session ID:
trans-unit.target: You must always specify a journal file when running the Azure Import/Export tool, as well as a copy session ID:

trans-unit.source: Command line parameter
trans-unit.target: Command line parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: <system>/j:</system><JournalFile>
trans-unit.target: <system>/j:</system><JournalFile>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The path to the journal file.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The path to the journal file.

trans-unit.source: Each drive must have exactly one journal file.
trans-unit.target: Each drive must have exactly one journal file.

trans-unit.source: Note that the journal file must not reside on the target drive.
trans-unit.target: Note that the journal file must not reside on the target drive.

trans-unit.source: The journal file extension is <codeInline>.jrn</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The journal file extension is <codeInline>.jrn</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: <system>/id:</system><SessionId>
trans-unit.target: <system>/id:</system><SessionId>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The session ID identifies a copy session.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The session ID identifies a copy session.

trans-unit.source: It is used to ensure accurate recovery of an interrupted copy session.
trans-unit.target: It is used to ensure accurate recovery of an interrupted copy session.

trans-unit.source: Files that are copied in a copy session are stored in a directory named after the session ID on the target drive.
trans-unit.target: Files that are copied in a copy session are stored in a directory named after the session ID on the target drive.

trans-unit.source: Parameters for Copying a Single Directory
trans-unit.target: Parameters for Copying a Single Directory

trans-unit.source: When copying a single directory, the following required and optional parameters apply:
trans-unit.target: When copying a single directory, the following required and optional parameters apply:

trans-unit.source: Command line parameter
trans-unit.target: Command line parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: <system>/srcdir:</system><SourceDirectory>
trans-unit.target: <system>/srcdir:</system><SourceDirectory>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The source directory that contains files to be copied to the target drive.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The source directory that contains files to be copied to the target drive.

trans-unit.source: The directory path must be an absolute path (not a relative path).
trans-unit.target: The directory path must be an absolute path (not a relative path).

trans-unit.source: <system>/dstdir:</system><DestinationBlobVirtualDirectory>
trans-unit.target: <system>/dstdir:</system><DestinationBlobVirtualDirectory>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The path to the destination virtual directory in your Windows Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The path to the destination virtual directory in your Windows Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: The virtual directory may or may not already exist.
trans-unit.target: The virtual directory may or may not already exist.

trans-unit.source: You can specify a container, or a blob prefix like <codeInline>music/70s/</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: You can specify a container, or a blob prefix like <codeInline>music/70s/</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The destination directory must begin with the container name, followed by a forward slash "/", and optionally may include a virtual blob directory that ends with "/".
trans-unit.target: The destination directory must begin with the container name, followed by a forward slash "/", and optionally may include a virtual blob directory that ends with "/".

trans-unit.source: When the destination container is the root container, you must explicitly specify the root container, including the forward slash, as <codeInline>$root/</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: When the destination container is the root container, you must explicitly specify the root container, including the forward slash, as <codeInline>$root/</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Since blobs under the root container cannot include "/" in their names, any subdirectories in the source directory will not be copied when the destination directory is the root container.
trans-unit.target: Since blobs under the root container cannot include "/" in their names, any subdirectories in the source directory will not be copied when the destination directory is the root container.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to use valid container names when specifying destination virtual directories or blobs.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to use valid container names when specifying destination virtual directories or blobs.

trans-unit.source: Keep in mind that container names must be lowercase.
trans-unit.target: Keep in mind that container names must be lowercase.

trans-unit.source: For container naming rules, see <link xlink:href="d525950c-17ba-4b3b-9ed1-19a2145f769a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata</link>.
trans-unit.target: For container naming rules, see <link xlink:href="d525950c-17ba-4b3b-9ed1-19a2145f769a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata</link>.

trans-unit.source: <system>/Disposition:</system><rename|no-overwrite|overwrite>
trans-unit.target: <system>/Disposition:</system><rename|no-overwrite|overwrite>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specifies the behavior when a blob with the specified address already exists.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specifies the behavior when a blob with the specified address already exists.

trans-unit.source: Valid values for this parameter are: <codeInline>rename</codeInline>, <codeInline>no-overwrite</codeInline> and <codeInline>overwrite</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Valid values for this parameter are: <codeInline>rename</codeInline>, <codeInline>no-overwrite</codeInline> and <codeInline>overwrite</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Note that these values are case-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: Note that these values are case-sensitive.

trans-unit.source: If no value is specified, the default is <codeInline>rename</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: If no value is specified, the default is <codeInline>rename</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The value specified for this parameter affects all the files in the directory specified by the <codeInline>/srcdir</codeInline> parameter.
trans-unit.target: The value specified for this parameter affects all the files in the directory specified by the <codeInline>/srcdir</codeInline> parameter.

trans-unit.source: <system>/BlobType:</system><BlockBlob|PageBlob>
trans-unit.target: <system>/BlobType:</system><BlockBlob|PageBlob>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specifies the blob type for the destination blobs.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specifies the blob type for the destination blobs.

trans-unit.source: Valid values are: <codeInline>BlockBlob</codeInline> and <codeInline>PageBlob</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Valid values are: <codeInline>BlockBlob</codeInline> and <codeInline>PageBlob</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Note that these values are case-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: Note that these values are case-sensitive.

trans-unit.source: If no value is specified, the default is <codeInline>BlockBlob</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: If no value is specified, the default is <codeInline>BlockBlob</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: In most cases, <codeInline>BlockBlob</codeInline> is recommended.
trans-unit.target: In most cases, <codeInline>BlockBlob</codeInline> is recommended.

trans-unit.source: If you specify <codeInline>PageBlob</codeInline>, the length of each file in the directory must be a multiple of 512, the size of a page for page blobs.
trans-unit.target: If you specify <codeInline>PageBlob</codeInline>, the length of each file in the directory must be a multiple of 512, the size of a page for page blobs.

trans-unit.source: <system>/PropertyFile:</system><PropertyFile>
trans-unit.target: <system>/PropertyFile:</system><PropertyFile>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Path to the property file for the destination blobs.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Path to the property file for the destination blobs.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="840364c6-d9a8-4b43-a9f3-f7441c625069" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Import/Export Service Metadata and Properties File Format</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="840364c6-d9a8-4b43-a9f3-f7441c625069" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Import/Export Service Metadata and Properties File Format</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: <system>/MetadataFile:</system><MetadataFile>
trans-unit.target: <system>/MetadataFile:</system><MetadataFile>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Path to the metadata file for the destination blobs.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Path to the metadata file for the destination blobs.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="840364c6-d9a8-4b43-a9f3-f7441c625069" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Import/Export Service Metadata and Properties File Format</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="840364c6-d9a8-4b43-a9f3-f7441c625069" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Import/Export Service Metadata and Properties File Format</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Parameters for Copying a Single File
trans-unit.target: Parameters for Copying a Single File

trans-unit.source: When copying a single file, the following required and optional parameters apply:
trans-unit.target: When copying a single file, the following required and optional parameters apply:

trans-unit.source: Command line parameter
trans-unit.target: Command line parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: <system>/srcfile:</system><SourceFile>
trans-unit.target: <system>/srcfile:</system><SourceFile>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The full path to the file to be copied.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The full path to the file to be copied.

trans-unit.source: The directory path must be an absolute path (not a relative path).
trans-unit.target: The directory path must be an absolute path (not a relative path).

trans-unit.source: <system>/dstblob:</system><DestinationBlobPath>
trans-unit.target: <system>/dstblob:</system><DestinationBlobPath>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The path to the destination blob in your Windows Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Required.</languageKeyword> The path to the destination blob in your Windows Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: The blob may or may not already exist.
trans-unit.target: The blob may or may not already exist.

trans-unit.source: Specify the blob name beginning with the container name.
trans-unit.target: Specify the blob name beginning with the container name.

trans-unit.source: The blob name cannot start with "/" or the storage account name.
trans-unit.target: The blob name cannot start with "/" or the storage account name.

trans-unit.source: For blob naming rules, see <link xlink:href="d525950c-17ba-4b3b-9ed1-19a2145f769a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata</link>.
trans-unit.target: For blob naming rules, see <link xlink:href="d525950c-17ba-4b3b-9ed1-19a2145f769a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming and Referencing Containers, Blobs, and Metadata</link>.

trans-unit.source: When the destination container is the root container, you must explicitly specify <codeInline>$root</codeInline> as the container, such as <codeInline>$root/sample.txt</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: When the destination container is the root container, you must explicitly specify <codeInline>$root</codeInline> as the container, such as <codeInline>$root/sample.txt</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Note that blobs under the root container cannot include "/" in their names.
trans-unit.target: Note that blobs under the root container cannot include "/" in their names.

trans-unit.source: <system>/Disposition:</system><rename|no-overwrite|overwrite>
trans-unit.target: <system>/Disposition:</system><rename|no-overwrite|overwrite>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specifies the behavior when a blob with the specified address already exists.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specifies the behavior when a blob with the specified address already exists.

trans-unit.source: Valid values for this parameter are: <codeInline>rename</codeInline>, <codeInline>no-overwrite</codeInline> and <codeInline>overwrite</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Valid values for this parameter are: <codeInline>rename</codeInline>, <codeInline>no-overwrite</codeInline> and <codeInline>overwrite</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Note that these values are case-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: Note that these values are case-sensitive.

trans-unit.source: If no value is specified, the default is <codeInline>rename</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: If no value is specified, the default is <codeInline>rename</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: <system>/BlobType:</system><BlockBlob|PageBlob>
trans-unit.target: <system>/BlobType:</system><BlockBlob|PageBlob>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specifies the blob type for the destination blobs.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Specifies the blob type for the destination blobs.

trans-unit.source: Valid values are: <codeInline>BlockBlob</codeInline> and <codeInline>PageBlob</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Valid values are: <codeInline>BlockBlob</codeInline> and <codeInline>PageBlob</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Note that these values are case-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: Note that these values are case-sensitive.

trans-unit.source: If no value is specified, the default is <codeInline>BlockBlob</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: If no value is specified, the default is <codeInline>BlockBlob</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: In most cases, <codeInline>BlockBlob</codeInline> is recommended.
trans-unit.target: In most cases, <codeInline>BlockBlob</codeInline> is recommended.

trans-unit.source: If you specify <codeInline>PageBlob</codeInline>, the length of each file in the directory must be a multiple of 512, the size of a page for page blobs.
trans-unit.target: If you specify <codeInline>PageBlob</codeInline>, the length of each file in the directory must be a multiple of 512, the size of a page for page blobs.

trans-unit.source: <system>/PropertyFile:</system><PropertyFile>
trans-unit.target: <system>/PropertyFile:</system><PropertyFile>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Path to the property file for the destination blobs.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Path to the property file for the destination blobs.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="840364c6-d9a8-4b43-a9f3-f7441c625069" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Import/Export Service Metadata and Properties File Format</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="840364c6-d9a8-4b43-a9f3-f7441c625069" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Import/Export Service Metadata and Properties File Format</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: <system>/MetadataFile:</system><MetadataFile>
trans-unit.target: <system>/MetadataFile:</system><MetadataFile>

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Path to the metadata file for the destination blobs.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Optional.</languageKeyword> Path to the metadata file for the destination blobs.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="840364c6-d9a8-4b43-a9f3-f7441c625069" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Import/Export Service Metadata and Properties File Format</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="840364c6-d9a8-4b43-a9f3-f7441c625069" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Import/Export Service Metadata and Properties File Format</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Resuming an Interrupted Copy Session
trans-unit.target: Resuming an Interrupted Copy Session

trans-unit.source: If a copy session is interrupted for any reason, you can resume it by running the tool with only the journal file specified:
trans-unit.target: If a copy session is interrupted for any reason, you can resume it by running the tool with only the journal file specified:

trans-unit.source: Only the most recent copy session, if terminated abnormally, can be resumed.
trans-unit.target: Only the most recent copy session, if terminated abnormally, can be resumed.

trans-unit.source: When you resume a copy session, do not modify the source data files and directories by adding or removing files.
trans-unit.target: When you resume a copy session, do not modify the source data files and directories by adding or removing files.

trans-unit.source: Aborting an Interrupted Copy Session
trans-unit.target: Aborting an Interrupted Copy Session

trans-unit.source: If a copy session is interrupted and it is not possible to resume (for example, if a source directory proved inaccessible), you must abort the current session so that it can be rolled back and new copy sessions can be started:
trans-unit.target: If a copy session is interrupted and it is not possible to resume (for example, if a source directory proved inaccessible), you must abort the current session so that it can be rolled back and new copy sessions can be started:

trans-unit.source: Only the last copy session, if terminated abnormally, can be aborted.
trans-unit.target: Only the last copy session, if terminated abnormally, can be aborted.

trans-unit.source: Note that you cannot abort the first copy session for a drive.
trans-unit.target: Note that you cannot abort the first copy session for a drive.

trans-unit.source: Instead you must restart the copy session with a new journal file.
trans-unit.target: Instead you must restart the copy session with a new journal file.
